New Records: Lautaro Martínez scored twice, extending his tournament-leading goal count to four.
Argentina secured a 2-0 win, clinching group play with three consecutive victories, aiming for a record 16th Copa America title.
Key Match Events: Lautaro Martínez scored the opening goal in the 47th minute after a precise through ball from Ángel Di María.
Martínez doubled his goals in the 86th minute.
Nicolás Tagliafico had a goal ruled out due to a blocked save by Peru's goalkeeper.
Argentina was awarded a penalty after a handball, but Leandro Paredes missed the shot.
Pre-Game Insights: Lionel Messi was absent due to a leg injury sustained in the match against Chile.
Argentina's coach Lionel Scaloni was serving a suspension, with assistant Walter Samuel leading the team.
The match was played in front of about 64,000 fans, many wearing Messi's No. 10 jersey.
Post-Match Reflections: Argentina's assistant coach Walter Samuel provided an update on Messi's injury, noting it's day-to-day.
Peru coach Jorge Fossati criticized the team's performance, calling it the weakest of their three matches.
The win moved Argentina closer to the World Cup spot, with the knockout stage opponent to be determined.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was held at Hard Rock Stadium, also set to host the final.
Canada's draw with Chile in another Group A match affected the standings.
